dublinCore.dc:title: 119 S1874 IS: Title VIII Nursing Workforce Reauthorization Act of 2025
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Merkley (for himself, Ms. Collins, Ms. Baldwin, Mrs. Blackburn, Mr. Blumenthal, Mr. Coons, Mrs. Gillibrand, Mr. Kelly, Mr. Schiff, and Ms. Murkowski) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions

form.official-title: To amend the Public Health Service Act to reauthorize certain nursing workforce development programs, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Title VIII Nursing Workforce Reauthorization Act of 2025.
Section 811 of the Public Health Service Act (42 U.S.C. 296j) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (a)(2), by striking programs. and inserting the following: “programs, including individuals enrolled in—

subparagraph.text: authorized nurse practitioner programs described in subsection (c);
authorized nurse-midwifery programs described in subsection (d);
authorized nurse anesthesia programs described in subsection (e); and
authorized clinical nurse specialist programs described in subsection (f).
in paragraph (1), by striking midwives and inserting nurse-midwives; and
in paragraph (2), by striking American College of Nurse-Midwives; and

paragraph.text: in subsection (h)(1)(A), by striking fees and inserting fees, including costs for clinical education and preceptors,.

section.header: Strengthening capacity for nurse education and practice

subsection.text: Part D of title VIII of the Public Health Service Act (42 U.S.C. 296p et seq.) is amended—

paragraph.text: in the part heading, by striking basic; and

clause.text: in paragraph (1), by striking or after the semicolon;

in paragraph (2), by striking methodologies. and inserting methodologies, audiovisual or other equipment, simulation and augmented reality resources, telehealth technologies, and virtual and physical laboratories; or; and
by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: increasing the number of faculty and students at schools of nursing in order to address nursing workforce shortages.

clause.text: in paragraph (2), by striking and survivors of domestic violence and inserting survivors of domestic violence, and survivors of sexual assault;
in paragraph (3), by striking or after the semicolon;
in paragraph (4), by striking the period and inserting ; or; and
by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: partnering with a health care facility, nurse-managed health clinic, community health center, or other facility that provides health care in order to provide education opportunities for the purpose of establishing or expanding clinical education.

subsection.text: Section 806(f)(2)(C) of the Public Health Service Act (42 U.S.C. 296e(f)(2)(C)) is amended by striking basic.

section.text: Section 871 of the Public Health Service Act (42 U.S.C. 298d) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (a), by striking $137,837,000 for each of fiscal years 2021 through 2025 and inserting $184,337,000 for each of fiscal years 2026 through 2030; and
in subsection (b), by striking $117,135,000 for each of the fiscal years 2021 through 2025 and inserting $121,135,000 for each of fiscal years 2026 through 2030.
